replies.bodyText: I haven't reviewed this PR at all but Thomas makes a good point about transactions. Usually in Nuxeo we are in a context where as an invariant a transaction is already active, so this kind of if is redundant and confusing. If we're not in a context where we know whether or not we're in a transaction, then it's rare and should be documented.

                                 .collect(Collectors.toList())

And personally I like to do a static import of Collectors.toList but it's up to you.

timeline.bodyHTML:
Instead of this try/finally block that has to do a check, it's better to enclose the inner par that needs to be outside a transaction with

                 TransactionHelper.commitOrRollbackTransaction();
                 try {
                     TranscodedVideo transcodedVideo = null;
                     try {
                         transcodedVideo = videoService.convert(video, conversion);
                     } catch (ConversionException e) {
                         log.warn("Conversion: {} of doc id: {} has failed", conversion, docId);
                     }
                 } finally {
                     TransactionHelper.startTransaction();
                 }

Which can be even reduced to:

                 TranscodedVideo transcodedVideo;
                 TransactionHelper.commitOrRollbackTransaction();
                 try {
                     transcodedVideo = videoService.convert(video, conversion);
                 } catch (ConversionException e) {
                     log.warn("Conversion: {} of doc id: {} has failed", conversion, docId);
                     transcodedVideo = null;
                 } finally {
                     TransactionHelper.startTransaction();
                 }
